required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Ultrasound Therapy on Bilateral Masseter Myalgia: Comparison of 1 Megahertz Versus 3 Megahertz
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Ultrasound Therapy on Bilateral Masseter Myalgia: Comparison of 1 Megahertz Versus 3 Megahertz

lead_sponsor.agency: State University of New York at Buffalo

clinical_study.source: State University of New York at Buffalo

brief_summary.textblock: Temporomandibular disorders (TMD) are a group of musculoskeletal and neuromuscular conditions that involve the temporomandibular joints, the masticatory muscles, and all associated tissues. These disorders are characterized by regional pain and limitation of mandibular range of motion. Pain-related TMD affects approximately 5% to 12% of the population and can affect individual's quality of life. The incidence is about 4 percent. Therapeutic ultrasound is a type of physical therapy that delivers energy via propagation of ultrasonic waves. One gap in knowledge is whether 1 megahertz (MHz) treating frequency has the same efficacy as treating with 3 MHz. This research proposes to test that.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Subjects will be randomized to double-blind treatment with 1 MHz or 3 MHz therapeutic ultrasound.
study_design_info.masking_description: The frequency setting on the ultrasound machine will be set and known only to the principal investigator.

primary_outcome.measure: Reduction in masseter pain by visual analog pain scale.
primary_outcome.description: Reduction in masseter pain as measured on a visual analog scale (VAS). The VAS runs from 0 (no pain at all) to 100 (worst pain imaginable).

primary_outcome.measure: Reduction in masseter pain by pressure pain threshold.
primary_outcome.description: Reduction in masseter pain as measured with the pressure pain threshold (VAS). The VAS runs from 0 (no pain at all) to 100 (worst pain imaginable)..

arm_group.description: The 1 MHz group will receive therapeutic ultrasound at the 1 MHz setting.
The 3 MHz group will receive therapeutic ultrasound at the 3 MHz setting.

intervention.description: A commercially available ultrasound machine will provide 5 minutes of ultrasound at 0.4 watt/cm^2 and 100% duty cycle sequentially to each masseter muscle.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult females
- Bilateral myalgia based on Diagnostic Criteria for TMD (DC-TMD) criteria
- An average pain of 5 or more on a 0 to 10 scale over the last 30 days.
Exclusion Criteria:
- A history or diagnosis of systemic musculoskeletal disorders or rheumatologic diseases (e.g. fibromyalgia, muscular atrophy).
- Certain conditions such as neoplasms or fractures.
- Neuropathies or neurological disorders.
- Currently taking muscle relaxants or analgesics.
- Undergone any form of physical therapy within the last 60 days.
- Severe bruxism requiring mouth-guard treatment.

overall_official.affiliation: State University of New York at Buffalo

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: State University of New York at Buffalo

patient_data.ipd_description: De-identified data may be shared after analysis completed.
